channel.title: Auto cache DL problems! please help
channel.description:
Ok so ive been trying to get this to work for past 5 or more days and this is what ive been getting
[img]http://i.imgur.com/fTYCCeq.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/HEZ3osd.png[/img]
PLease help me!

item.title: Auto cache DL problems! please help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:550219”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=669128.msg4474443#msg4474443 date=1424897495]
“The system cannot find the specified file.” Read the CMD lol
It can’t find 1063.dat
[/quote]
Can you stop being such a basic bitch? XD

Jokes aside, OP:
Your error in the CMD is because it cannot unzip correctly.

The download percentage error can come from a numerous of things, one being incorrectly zipping the file (oddly enough).

Right click your desktop. Hover over “New”, and select Either New Zip Archive or New WINZip Archive. It is the same thing, but the latter only shows up if you’ve made WINRar the default viewer for .zip files.
Now that you’ve made the new file. Title it whatever you want it to be named.

Double click the file so it is now open in either windows explorer or WINRar (WINRar is faster at this).

Once it’s open, in another window navigate to the folder that has your cache. Enter it
Select everything in that folder, then drag and drop it onto the opened zip archive.
After that process is done, you need to upload the zip to your dropbox and update your link.[/quote]
woah sorry boss

fudgein hell relax

[size=4pt]bitch.[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: Auto cache DL problems! please help

item.title: Auto cache DL problems! please help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:2, topic:550219”]“The system cannot find the specified file.” Read the CMD lol
It can’t find 1063.dat[/quote]
Can you stop being such a basic bitch? XD

Jokes aside, OP:
Your error in the CMD is because it cannot unzip correctly.

The download percentage error can come from a numerous of things, one being incorrectly zipping the file (oddly enough).

Right click your desktop. Hover over “New”, and select Either New Zip Archive or New WINZip Archive. It is the same thing, but the latter only shows up if you’ve made WINRar the default viewer for .zip files.
Now that you’ve made the new file. Title it whatever you want it to be named.

Double click the file so it is now open in either windows explorer or WINRar (WINRar is faster at this).

Once it’s open, in another window navigate to the folder that has your cache. Enter it
Select everything in that folder, then drag and drop it onto the opened zip archive.
After that process is done, you need to upload the zip to your dropbox and update your link.

Read full topic
